meanings.definition: To strike with an open hand; slap.
meanings.sent1: He was cuffing the table to show his frustration.
meanings.sent2: She was cuffing the ball during the game.
meanings.sent3: The clown was cuffing his own face for laughs.
meanings.sent4: The wind was cuffing the leaves off the trees.
meanings.sent5: The chef was cuffing the dough to make it smooth.

meanings.definition: A fold or band serving as a trimming or finish for the bottom of a sleeve.
meanings.sent1: Her dress had a beautiful cuffing at the sleeves.
meanings.sent2: The jacket had a cuffing that matched the collar.
meanings.sent3: The cuffing on the shirt was so fancy, it looked like lace.
meanings.sent4: The cuffing on the curtains added a touch of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent5: The cuffing on the pillowcases was embroidered with delicate flowers.

meanings.sent1: The police officer was cuffing the suspect after the arrest.
meanings.sent2: She was cuffing the criminal to prevent escape.
meanings.sent3: The magician was cuffing himself as part of the trick.
meanings.sent4: The security guard was cuffing the intruder to keep him under control.
meanings.sent5: The cowboy was cuffing the bandit before taking him to jail.
